RESTIC_PASSWORD.description: The actual password for the repository

RESTIC_PASSWORD_COMMAND.description: Command printing the password for the repository to stdout

RESTIC_KEY_HINT.description: ID of key to try decrypting first, before other keys

RESTIC_PROGRESS_FPS.description: Frames per second by which the progress bar is updated

ST_AUTH.description: Auth URL for keystone v1 authentication

OS_USER_ID.description: User ID for keystone v3 authentication

OS_TENANT_ID.description: Tenant ID for keystone v2 authentication

OS_TENANT_NAME.description: Tenant name for keystone v2 authentication

OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME.description: User domain name for keystone authentication

OS_USER_DOMAIN_ID.description: User domain ID for keystone v3 authentication

OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME.description: Project domain name for keystone authentication

OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_ID.description: Project domain ID for keystone v3 authentication

OS_TRUST_ID.description: Trust ID for keystone v3 authentication

B2_ACCOUNT_ID.description: Account ID or applicationKeyId for Backblaze B2

B2_ACCOUNT_KEY.description: Account Key or applicationKey for Backblaze B2

GOOGLE_PROJECT_ID.description: Project ID for Google Cloud Storage

GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS.description: Application Credentials for Google Cloud Storage (e.g. $HOME/.config/gs-secret-restic-key.json)

cacert.description: file to load root certificates from (default: use system certificates)

cache-dir.description: set the cache directory. (default: use system default cache directory)

json.description: set output mode to JSON for commands that support it

key-hint.description: key ID of key to try decrypting first (default: $RESTIC_KEY_HINT)

limit-download.description: limits downloads to a maximum rate in KiB/s. (default: unlimited)

limit-upload.description: limits uploads to a maximum rate in KiB/s. (default: unlimited)

no-cache.description: do not use a local cache

no-lock.description: do not lock the repo, this allows some operations on read-only repos

option.description: set extended option (key=value, can be specified multiple times)

password-command.description: specify a shell command to obtain a password (default: $RESTIC_PASSWORD_COMMAND)

password-file.description: read the repository password from a file (default: $RESTIC_PASSWORD_FILE)

quiet.description: do not output comprehensive progress report

repo.description: repository to backup to or restore from (default: $RESTIC_REPOSITORY)

tls-client-cert.description: path to a file containing PEM encoded TLS client certificate and private key

verbose.description: be verbose (specify --verbose multiple times or level n)

exclude.description: exclude a pattern (can be specified multiple times)

exclude-caches.description: excludes cache directories that are marked with a CACHEDIR.TAG file. See http://bford.info/cachedir/spec.html for the Cache Directory Tagging Standard

exclude-file.description: read exclude patterns from a file (can be specified multiple times)

exclude-if-present.description: takes filename[:header], exclude contents of directories containing filename (except filename itself) if header of that file is as provided (can be specified multiple times)

files-from.description: read the files to backup from file (can be combined with file args/can be specified multiple times)

force.description: force re-reading the target files/directories (overrides the "parent" flag)

host.description: set the hostname for the snapshot manually. To prevent an expensive rescan use the "parent" flag

iexclude.description: same as --exclude but ignores the casing of filenames

ignore-inode.description: ignore inode number changes when checking for modified files

parent.description: use this parent snapshot (default: last snapshot in the repo that has the same target files/directories)

tag.description: add a tag for the new snapshot (can be specified multiple times)

with-atime.description: store the atime for all files and directories
